---=Note=----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Very good quality DVDrip. Please remember that this was a sponsored documentary which Schroeder was forced to cut (restored in this version) as the General literally held French nationals at gunpoint. That is, the quality of the original film isn't much even by 1975 standards.

---=Wiki=----------------------------------------------------------------------------
General Idi Amin Dada: A Self Portrait (French: GÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©nÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©ral Idi Amin Dada: Autoportrait) is a 1974 documentary film by French director Barbet Schroeder. It was made with the support and participation of its subject, the Ugandan dictator Idi Amin. The film depicts Amin at the height of his power as ruler of Uganda.

The film is an extended character study of its subject. It follows Amin closely in a series of formal and informal settings, combined with several short interviews in which Amin expounds his unconventional theories of politics, economics, and international relations. Amin is seen supervising the Ugandan paratrooper school, boating through a wildlife park, playing the accordion in a jazz band at a formal dinner, and staging a mock assault on a small hill representing the Golan Heights.
